page.title: 13WARRINGTON AMBULANCE SERVICE
page.content: The Warrington branch originated as a direct result of the Second World War. Today it has five first line ambulances, two tail-lift ambulances and eight sitting ambulances. The station is fully staffed for five days a week, with 21 staff altogether, but at weekends the number can drop as low as 8. These are on duty for emergencies only. The most common accidents catered for by the station are road accidents. This is mainly due to the three main motorways surrounding the town - M6,M62 and M56, but also because of the traffic congestion caused by the two crossing points of the Mersey. Although there are recreational facilities at the Ambulance station - table-tennis,pool,darts and television - they are not available after 6 p.m.
